title: Cinefund - Residual backed NFTs
description: Creating and investing in film and video projects should be transparent and lucrative. However over 50% of revenue made goes to middlemen.

f6_assessments.q0:
Challenging the hugely influential film studios and streaming services is a massive undertaking. Therefore it's a bit unclear what can be achieved with this small budget. Yet, if we wish to introduce and test decentralized bottom up approaches this kind of experimental approach is the only possibility.

Another similar proposal is asking for $90,000 USD: https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Collude-Empowering-Artists-In-Film/366753-48088

Perhaps you could combine forces with them?
f6_assessments.q1:
Based on the awesome quality of the linked websites and videos, this looks like a highly capable duo. The plan also sounds feasible and I'm sure they could pull it off.

I'm a writer / screenwriter so I understand the industry a little bit. My skills with NFTs, however, are limited. I cannot therefore judge the feasibility of the plan in its entirety.
f6_assessments.q2: Now I'm not sure if this is intended to be a way to fund the said "existing unreleased film project" or if it actually wishes to be a service for other creators. Does that unreleased project involve motor cycles by any chance? :)

f6_assessments.q0:
the proposal highlighted  problem of getting funding in the movie space especially for indies and proposed a wonderful solution, however the proposal failed to highlight a situation in which the film-maker defaults (doesn't deliver the movie which was funded) in producing the movie after being crowd funded.
What happens to the NFT given to the community that funds the movie ?
Answering this questions will help investors to feel safe as just minting NFTs doesn't necessarily mean the project will be delivered.

I can neither agree nor disagree
f6_assessments.q1:
the proposal provided verifiable links to given experience and a clear implementation plan was provided with cost implication.

I agree
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provided sufficient information to help audit its progress and success .
I agree.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge of creating a business model with NFTs at its core. I would like the team to expand on how the proposal will deliver value to the Cardano ecosystem since the team plans to mint an existing unreleased film project into NFTs hosted on Arweave + IPFS. Will the team bridge Arweave to Cardano?
f6_assessments.q1: Using NFTs to crowdfund media production is a good idea. However the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. The team can expand on the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal, what are the responsibilities and deliverables of each member. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed". I would like the team to provide a deeper explanation about the architecture and language for the implementation of the back end of the product– servers, hosting, support etc. Lastly, I would like the team to expand on the plan to go to market, acquire customers and sign up of video projects.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided a timeline with a budget. I would like to see the team further develop and define Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project – for example, "Fund 5 projects by month 2, or sign up 1000 customers by month x, etc"– set measurables for performance and use it as a KPI, then connect the KPI to the milestones on the project roadmap. I would like the team to connect the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the budget, in this way you can track performance and spending over a timeline. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project will be difficult to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: As a filmmaker this would be a great service to add to others. I was thinking I would have to generate my own tokens to do something similar, but this would negate having filmmakers try to also be developers. Films provide great marketing opportunities, and this team will also be marketing their token drop. This is a good chance for Cardano to gain some press while also providing a needed service.
f6_assessments.q1: I am a bit concerned about Tyler's credentials on blockchain skills. It would have been nice to have seen more touted experience about smart contracts, or the funds reserved to hire a consultant. However, the plan is that for this first phase that more expert help is hired using funds from their token sales, and not from Catalyst. It would seem that apx. $10,000 should be enough to produce their first tier of development, and then use other funding methods for their other tiers.
f6_assessments.q2: They provide a simple placeholder website, and their own personal website for information and I think these things are at least adequate for auditing this proposal. I think it important to focus on their first tier deliverables, and that $10,000 could, but to me is on a borderline, produce a proof-of-concept that include minting NFT and other tokens. This team has done its homework though in initial R & D, and their presented findings so far seem to validate this project as one that could benefit Cardano and the filmmaking community.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a very intriguing proposal that presents a novel solution to the issue of paying royalties to content creators and stakeholders alike and would, if successful, present a new business modal utilizing Cardano NFTs to pursue new avenues of revenue rather than the top-down approach that Hollywood has a stranglehold on, determining what gets produced and what doesn't. 

Cinefund opens the door for smaller content creators to crowdfund their projects using the public - which can then actually become stakeholders in the project itself, thereby rewarding them for participating in the project.

Cinefund is a perfect fit for the challenge of creating new NFT models.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal for Cinefund is well thought out, the team has presented themselves as competent and capable of delivering and implementing this proposal successfully.

Given the roadmap and the budget requested, I find it highly likely that Cinefund will successfully implement their solution to market, and have some active users by the end of their presented roadmap.
f6_assessments.q2:
I would like to see a bit more specific details for the KPIs in the roadmap milestones for Cinefund, but the milestones themselves make sense and can be used to measure the success of the proposal.

i.e. "Build community of creators, investors, prosumers (discord, twitter, email list)" 

I would like to see x,xxx number of these categories as
 part of this mllestone, and how many users of Cinefund are active and each milestone. 

It would go a long way to auditing the success of this proposal. Other than that, the project catalyst should have enough information to determine that the proposal was successfully implemented.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal presents a great idea for a non-art business model for NFTs that could bring mass adoption for businesses to cardano. This is a large industry that could help cement cardano as the commercial NFT blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has the experience required in both their related field of cinema, as well as tech dvelopment. They have had a prior proposal funded and are currently working on that project as well. They have a long term plan with a long term team which gives confidence this will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: They do provide a plan and some key milestons, but I would like to see details on measurable success metrics they are shooting for as the proposal progresses instead of just black and white milestones.

solution: A decentralized platform that ties future residuals to tradable NFTs. Mint and sell NFTs pegged to residuals for upfront funding.
experience: 20+ years of combined experience in entrepreneurship, film production, and product development + management
